title: "b/b" in type spec?
content: I'm probably just being ignorant, but we have a type spec here from the previous publisher of a publication we've acquired, and in some places it says things like "27pts b/b above to last text line" or "8pts b/b below to doi line" ... I know what everything else means but what does "b/b" stand for?
author: dtw

comments.content:
Ah, thanks Jackson. I got the feeling that, from the context, I wasn't missing out on anything by _not_ knowing – and I was right, it would all make just as much sense without them having said that – but it's the sort of thing that niggles, you know?

Cheers  
\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_  
Ever since I chose to block pop-ups, my toaster's stopped working.
It's an archaic term, but you're always better off triple checking.
